fields.headline: The Lives of the Saints
fields.bodyText: The Lives of the Saints, the joint feature debut of Chris Cottam and the photographer who styles himself Rankin, is an ambitious, addled allegory about the sudden arrival of an angelic child in the ethnically-mixed Green Lanes district of Haringey, north London. He helps everyone he looks upon to fulfil their dreams, turning a cowardly teenager into a dangerous gangster, making a crime boss's loser son into a winner, liberating a Catholic priest into becoming a drag performer, and so on. It ends tragically and is as painfully hypnotic as watching a religious zealot ranting in the street and carrying a banner proclaiming the second coming.
